EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: AGRICULTURE AND AGRI-FOOD ADMINISTRATIVE MONETARY PENALTIES ACT

Identification.LongTitle: Agriculture and Agri-Food Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations

Provision.Text: The Minister of Agriculture and Agri-Food, pursuant to subsection 4(1) of the Agriculture and Agri-Food Administrative Monetary Penalties Acta, hereby makes the annexed Agriculture and Agri-Food Administrative Monetary Penalties Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Agriculture and Agri-Food Administrative Monetary Penalties Act. (Loi)
import reference document has the same meaning as in section 10 of the Health of Animals Regulations. (document de référence)

Section.Text: The following are designated as violations that may be proceeded with in accordance with the Act, namely

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the contravention of a provision of the Health of Animals Act, the Plant Protection Act or the Meat Inspection Act, or of a regulation made under one of those Acts, that is set out in column 1 of Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the contravention of an order made by the Minister under a provision of the Plant Protection Act that is set out in column 1 of Schedule 1; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the refusal or neglect to perform any specified duty imposed by or under a provision of the Health of Animals Act or the Plant Protection Act, or of a regulation made under one of those Acts, that is set out in column 1 of Schedule 1.

Section.Text: The short-form descriptions that are set out in column 2 of Schedule 1 are established to be used in notices of violations in respect of violations of the corresponding provisions that are set out in column 1 of Schedule 1.
The classification of a violation as a minor, serious or very serious violation of a provision set out in column 1 of an item of Schedule 1 is as set out in column 3 of that item.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the penalty in respect of a violation that is committed by an individual otherwise than in the course of a business and that is not committed to obtain a financial benefit is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $500, for a minor violation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: $800, for a serious violation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: $1300, for a very serious violation.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the penalty in respect of a minor violation that is committed by a person in the course of a business or in order to obtain a financial benefit is $1,300.

The amount of the penalty in respect of a violation that is committed by a person in the course of a business or in order to obtain a financial benefit is $6,000 for a serious violation and $10,000 for a very serious violation, with adjustments, if any, determined for each total gravity value, as established in accordance with section 6, that is set out in column 1 of Schedule 2 in accordance with the calculation set out in column 2.

Section.Text: The total gravity value in respect of each serious or very serious violation referred to in subsection 5(3) shall be established by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: considering the following criteria:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the history of the person who committed the violation in respect of prior violations or convictions as described in column 2 of an item of Part 1 of Schedule 3,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the degree of intention or negligence on the part of the person who committed the violation as described in column 2 of an item of Part 2 of Schedule 3, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the harm done or that could be done by the violation as described in column 2 of an item of Part 3 of Schedule 3;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ascribing, for each of the criteria referred to in subparagraphs (a)(i), (ii) and (iii), the applicable gravity value that is set out in column 1 of an item of Parts 1, 2 and 3 of Schedule 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: adding the values obtained under paragraph (b).

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), where the Minister agrees to enter into a compliance agreement and the terms and conditions of the agreement include monetary expenditures to be made by a person, the amount of the penalty shall be reduced by one dollar for every two dollars spent by the person, with a maximum reduction to nil.

The amount set out in a notice of default served pursuant to subsection 10(4) of the Act shall be paid by certified cheque or money order made payable to the Receiver General for Canada within 15 days after service of the notice.
Service of a notice of violation or any document originating from the Minister on an individual named in the notice or document may be made

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: personally, by leaving a copy of it

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: with the individual at any place, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is impracticable to find the individual, with someone who appears to be an adult member of the same household at the last known address or usual place of residence of the individual. The day on which the document is left with that person is deemed to be the day on which the document is served; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by sending a copy of it by registered mail or courier to the last known address or usual place of residence of the individual, or by sending a copy of it to the individual by fax or other electronic means.

Subsection.Text: Service of a notice of violation or any document originating from the Minister on a person other than an individual may be effected by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sending a copy of it by fax, registered mail or courier to the head office or place of business of the person or to the person’s agent;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: leaving a copy of it at the person’s head office or place of business, with an officer or other individual who appears to be in control or management of the head office or place of business or with the person’s agent; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sending a copy of it by electronic means other than by fax to any individual referred to in paragraph (b).

Subsection.Text: If a notice of violation or any document originating from the Minister is sent by fax or by other electronic means, a copy of the document shall be sent either by courier or by registered mail within 48 hours following the original transmission.
A certificate of service of a document required or authorized to be served under the Act must be in a form approved by the Minister.

If the certificate states that the document was served on a person named in the certificate and states the means of service, the person who signs the certificate is deemed to have served the document on that person on the date that is determined under subsections (2) to (4).
A document sent by registered mail is served on the 10th day after the date indicated in the receipt issued by a post office.
A document sent by courier is served on the 10th day after the date indicated in the courier’s receipt issued to the sender.
A document sent by fax or other electronic means is served on the date it is sent.

Subject to subsection (2), a person named in a notice of violation shall pay the amount of the penalty by certified cheque or money order made payable to the Receiver General of Canada within 30 days after the day on which the notice is served.
A person named in a notice of violation may pay an amount equal to one half of the penalty, in lieu of the penalty, within 15 days after the day on which the notice is served.
For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), payment is deemed to be made:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the date indicated in the postmark stamped on the envelope, where the amount is sent by regular mail; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the date indicated in the receipt issued by the post office or the courier, where the amount is sent by registered mail or courier.

Subsection.Text: Where a person named in a notice of violation that contains a warning requests, pursuant to subsection 8(1) of the Act, a review of the facts of the violation by the Minister or the Tribunal, the request shall be made in writing within 30 days after the day on which the notice is served.

Where a person named in a notice of violation that contains a penalty requests, pursuant to subsection 9(2) of the Act, a review of the facts of the violation by the Minister or the Tribunal or, if the penalty is $2,000 or more, to enter into a compliance agreement with the Minister, the request shall be made in writing within 30 days after the day on which the notice is served.
For the purposes of subsection (2), a request to enter into a compliance agreement shall include a proposal outlining in detail the corrective action that will be taken to ensure future compliance.

Section.Text: If a person is notified that the Minister refuses to enter into a compliance agreement, the time within which the person may pay the amount of the penalty or request a review by the Tribunal of the facts of the violation is 15 days after the day on which the notice is served. The request must be in writing.
If a person is notified that the Minister, having concluded a review, has decided that the person committed a violation

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the time within which the person may request a review of the Minister’s decision by the Tribunal is 15 days after the day on which the notice is served and the request must be in writing;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the review is in respect of a penalty, the time within which the person may pay the penalty that the Minister has maintained or the corrected amount that the Minister has decided on is 15 days after the day on which the notice is served.

Subsection.Text: A person may make a request referred to in section 11, 12 or 13 by delivering it by hand or by sending it by registered mail, courier or fax or other electronic means to a person and place authorized by the Minister.
Where a person makes a request referred to in subsection (1), the date of the request is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the request is delivered to the authorized recipient, if the request is delivered by hand;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the earlier of the date on which the request is received by the authorized recipient and the date on the receipt given to the person by a post office or courier, if the request is sent by registered mail or courier; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the request is sent, if the request is sent by fax or other electronic transmission.

Subsection.Text: If a request is sent by fax or by other electronic means, a hard copy of the request shall be sent either by courier or registered mail within 48 hours following the original transmission.
A review by the Tribunal shall be conducted orally where the person named in the notice of violation requests that the review be oral.

A review, whether conducted orally or through written representations, may include hearings by conference telephone, conference video or other electronic means where, in the Tribunal’s opinion, its deliberations will be assisted by those means.

Where a review is in respect of a penalty and the Tribunal maintains the penalty or corrects the amount of the penalty, the person who requested the review shall pay the penalty or the corrected amount within 30 days after the day on which notice of the Tribunal’s decision is served.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Health of Animals Act and Health of Animals Regulations

Fail to report the prescribed information to the administrator in the prescribed time

Fail to report the prescribed information on exported pigs to the administrator within the prescribed time
Fail to apply or cause the application of an approved tag to an imported animal in the prescribed time
Fail to report the prescribed information on an imported animal to the administrator within the prescribed time

Heading.Label: PART 3
Heading.TitleText: Meat Inspection Act and Meat Inspection Regulations, 1990

row.entry: Operate a registered establishment without a licence
Apply or use a meat inspection legend without authorization
Advertise, sell or possess for such a purpose a thing bearing, or in connection with which it is used, the meat inspection legend without authorization
Apply or use any legend, word, mark, symbol or design likely to be mistaken for the meat inspection legend
Advertise, sell or possess for such a purpose a thing bearing, or in connection with which it is used, any legend, word, mark, symbol or design likely to be mistaken for the meat inspection legend
Export a meat product without meeting requirements
Send or convey a meat product interprovincially without meeting requirements
Import a meat product without meeting requirements
Fail to deliver an imported meat product for inspection
Possess an imported meat product that has been unlawfully imported
Possess an imported meat product that has not been delivered to a registered establishment for inspection
Advertise, sell or possess for such a purpose a meat product that has been unlawfully imported
Advertise, sell or possess an imported meat product that has not been delivered to a registered establishment for inspection
Advertise, sell or possess for such a purpose a meat product that has been conveyed interprovincially without meeting the prescribed standards or without being packaged and labelled as prescribed

Advertise, sell or possess for such a purpose a meat product bearing, or in connection with which it is used, the meat inspection legend without meeting the prescribed standards or without being packaged and labelled as prescribed
Fail to give all reasonable assistance or to furnish information to the inspector
Obstruct or hinder inspector or make a false or misleading statement to inspector
Remove, alter or interfere with an item seized or detained by an inspector without authority
Fail to submit a document in writing in the prescribed manner
Identify as edible a meat product that does not comply with prescribed requirements
Fail to prepare meat products in accordance with prescribed process control requirements
Identify for use as animal food a meat product that does not comply with prescribed requirements
Transfer a licence to another person
Fail to keep and retain records of specific activities or procedures
Fail to develop, implement and maintain control programs and procedures as prescribed
Fail to keep records relevant to the prescribed control programs and procedures
Fail to operate a shared inspection program or a post-mortem examination program as prescribed
Fail to make available to an inspector any food animal, meat product or thing used in connection with a food animal or meat product
Fail to possess and maintain equipment and material necessary to operate the establishment
Fail to develop, implement or maintain a written sanitation program
Fail to keep records of monitoring and verification activities and corrective or preventative actions
Fail to develop, implement or maintain pest control program as prescribed
Prepare a food that is a mixture of a fish product and a meat product in a registered establishment
Fail to clean and sanitize hands as prescribed
Fail to keep clothing sanitary as prescribed
Fail to adhere to hygienic practices
Fail to wear clothing and footwear that are sound, clean and in a sanitary condition
Fail to wear a hair covering or a beard and moustache covering
Spit, chew gum, smoke or consume tobacco products or consume food
Wear an object or use a substance that may fall into or contaminate a meat product or ingredient
Fail to ensure that person with medical condition does not work in an area where there is a risk of contamination
Fail to report symptoms of condition that could be transmitted through a meat product
Fail to ensure that personnel are trained or qualified to perform their duties
Fail to develop, carry out and keep up-to-date a written training program as prescribed
Fail to keep records of the training of personnel as prescribed
Fail to carry out control programs as prescribed
Fail to ensure that low-acid meat product is thermally processed until commercial sterility is achieved
Fail to keep a written description of scheduled process and recipe of processed low-acid meat product
Fail to keep a written description of scheduled process and recipe of processed low-acid meat product for at least three years
Fail to keep in an establishment a written description of operation and maintenance procedures for units of thermal processing equipment as prescribed
Fail to keep in an establishment a written description of a low-acid meat product recall procedure
Fail to produce on inspector’s request a written statement regarding scheduled process
Fail to retain records containing the prescribed minimum information for product history for at least three years
Fail to notify an inspector when a low-acid meat product is to be recalled
Fail to ensure that a low-acid meat product packaged in a hermetically sealed container is processed as prescribed
Fail to investigate or notify an inspector when a meat product might constitute a risk to public health or might not meet requirements of Regulations
Fail to immediately notify the President when investigation indicates a meat product constitutes a risk to the public health
Fail to develop, implement or maintain written procedures for the recall as prescribed
Fail to develop and maintain product distribution records
Fail to review product recall procedures or to conduct a product recall simulation at least once a year
Fail to make available to the inspector the product recall procedures, the product recall simulation results and the product distribution records for the prescribed minimum period
Fail to prepare the written procedures as prescribed or to maintain prescribed records for receiving, insvestigating and responding to complaints
Fail to perform ante-mortem examination of a bird under supervision of official veterinarian, as prescribed
Fail to present a bird at the request of an inspector for ante-mortem inspection
Fail to wait for an inspector’s requested ante-mortem inspection and authorization before slaughtering a bird
Fail to comply with instructions from an official veterinarian
Fail to comply with instructions from an official veterinarian that a food animal must be condemned or held and segregated
Fail to ensure that every food animal designated as held is segregated and identified as being held or any carcass derived from it is identified as being held

Use of equipment or instrument for restraining, slaughtering or rendering unconscious any food animal by a person who is not competent to do so without sujecting the animal to avoidable distress or avoidable pain
Use of equipment or instrument on any food animal in condition, manner or circumstances that might subject the animal to avoidable distress or avoidable pain
Fail to ensure that the blood and parts of a food animal carcass are identified as prescribed
Fail to ensure that the carcass of a food animal and all the blood harvested for processing as edible meat product are presented for examination or inspection
Fail to comply with instructions from an official veterinarian
Fail to ensure that the carcass of, parts of the carcass of, or blood harvested from a food animal identified as condemned is handled as prescribed
Fail to ensure that a condemned part of the carcass of a food animal is removed from the carcass and handled as prescribed
Without an inspector’s consent, treat as condemned a meat product identified as being held
Fail to ensure that meat product is packaged and labelled as prescribed
Identify as edible a meat product intended for export that does not meet the requirements of the importing country and is not packaged and labelled as prescribed
Fail to package and label a meat product intended for export in accordance with the requirements of the importing country or as prescribed

Fail to ensure that a meat product produced for export, that does not meet the requirements for an edible meat product in Canada, is packaged and labelled as prescribed and is labelled as being for export
Fail to follow the prescribed procedure for the return to Canada of a meat product that was exported from Canada
Fail to present a meat product to an inspector for verification at the time and place of its removal
Remove or alter an official seal or tag without authorization
Fail to provide the inspector with requested samples
No previous violation under, or conviction for an offence committed under, agri-food Acts in the five years before the day on which the violation subject to the assessment is committed
One previous minor or serious violation has been committed under agri-food Acts in the five years before the day on which the violation subject to the assessment is committed
The history in the five years preceding the day on which the violation subject to the assessment is committed is other than the history set out in item 1 or 2.
The violation subject to the assessment is committed without intent or negligence.
The person who commits the violation subject to the assessment makes a voluntary disclosure of the violation and takes necessary steps to prevent its re-occurrence.
The violation subject to the assessment is committed through a negligent act.
The violation subject to the assessment is committed through an intentional act.

The violation subject to the assessment causes or could cause minor harm to(a)human, animal or plant health or the environment; or(b)any person as a result of false, misleading or deceptive practices.

The violation subject to the assessment could cause(a)serious or widespread harm to human, animal or plant health or the environment;(b)serious or widespread harm to any person as a result of false, misleading or deceptive practices; or(c)serious monetary losses to any person.

The violation subject to the assessment causes(a)serious or widespread harm to human, animal or plant health or the environment;(b)serious or widespread harm to any person as a result of false, misleading or deceptive practices; or(c)serious monetary losses to any person.
